content: @Sean had a question about the libdm postscript backend. If it becomes possible for us to capture postscript visualizations of the scene using gl2ps (perhaps using something like a --postscript option to the screengrab command) would we be able to remove the libdm postscript backend?
Also, I'm wondering if the plot backend might also be a candidate for removal? At least at the moment I'm having a hard time visualizing a use case for that particular output format these days...

I mean, I've used it and it has value in a general abstraction sense, but if there was a way to get equivalent or very similar vector output, that'd conceivably would make it a candidate for simplification.
I think the general idea is the ability to export/extract what's being displayed in some 3D vector parametric format.

There would be a usability change if it wasn't transparently interoperable with the various DM tools, but I don't think that's as critical as is simply the ability to save/export/convert the non-mesh 3D view data (e.g., the polylines, points, etc).
